∎
Wiring
Danger
!
Please make sure the power is off before wiring
Risk of electric shock and fire
When working on the main circuit terminal of the drive, the power must be cut off
More than 15 minutes, confirm that the capacitor discharge is completed before proceeding
Risk of electric shock
Ask professional electrical engineers to carry out the wiring work
Risk of electric shock and fire
The grounding terminal must be grounded reliably (ground resistance below 4Ω). There is a risk of electric shock and fire.
It is forbidden to connect the P/B and PE terminals directly, and it is forbidden to connect the neutral wire
Connect to the PE terminal
Cause a short circuit of the rectifier bridge and burn out the main circuit
It is forbidden to connect the high voltage line to the control terminal of the driver
Cause the control board to burn out
Please install emergency stop and lock circuit outside the controller
There is a risk of injury (wiring responsibility belongs to the user)
After turning on the power, do not directly touch the main circuit terminals
Risk of electric shock and short circuit
! Attention
Please confirm the AC input power of the main circuit and the rated power of the drive
Is the pressure consistent
Risk of injury and fire
Do not perform voltage and insulation tests on the drive at will
It will cause damage to the semiconductor and other devices inside the drive
Please connect the external braking resistor according to the wiring diagram
Risk of fire
Do not connect the AC input power cord to the U, V,
W on the output terminal
Will cause internal damage to the controller
Please tighten the main circuit and control circuit of the drive with appropriate torque
Terminal
There is a risk of fire, and the risk of driver malfunction
Do not connect phase-shifting electrolytic capacitors and LC/RC noise filters to
Output circuit
Will cause internal damage to the drive
Do not connect the electromagnetic switch or electromagnetic contactor to the output circuit.
To connect or disconnect the load
When the drive is running with a load, the surge current will cause
Start the protection circuit of the drive

Product Overview

Chapter One Product Overview
1.1.
Dynamic platform system overview
The MBOX dynamic platform system in this manual specifically refers to the multi-degree-of-freedom platform system of an electric cylinder driven by a servo motor.
It is widely used in motion simulation, robots, aircraft space rendezvous and docking simulators, ship and automobile simulators, new processing machine tools, and sanitary
Accurate motion simulation of aircraft such as satellites and missiles, as well as 4D dynamic seats, six-degree-of-freedom platform, etc., are
It is an important equipment indispensable for testing and training in weather, automobile manufacturing, machinery industry, and various complex environments.
The core of the MBOX dynamic platform system is the application of networked servo control system technology, except for the composition of servo motors and electric cylinders.
In addition to the electromechanical actuators, the HS series of networked servo drives and MBOX communication from Hollysys Motor Technology Co., Ltd.
The control board constitutes the core control component.
1.2.
Networked Servo Control System
Servo is to make the object's position, orientation, state and other output controlled quantities can follow the arbitrary changes of the input target (or given value)
Automatic control system. Its main task is to amplify, transform and adjust the power according to the requirements of the control command, so that
The torque, speed and position output of the drive device are very flexible and convenient. Modern AC Servo Drive Based on Permanent Magnet Synchronous Motor
The development and application of the computer is very fast and extensive. The performance and function are constantly improving and the price is getting cheaper and cheaper. It has started from the early CNC field.
Entered into a wide range of pan-industrial applications.
The control modes of AC servo drives are generally divided into position mode, speed mode and torque mode. Currently popular servo drives
The control interface to realize these three control modes is still hard-wired interface mode, namely pulse direction, digital IO and analog quantity mode.
This hard-wired interface mode is suitable for short-distance, small number of applications, when tens or even hundreds or even thousands of joint applications are required
At times, engineering wiring, long-distance transmission, control signal attenuation and even distortion, trouble diagnosis problems will follow one after another. At this
Under such application conditions, networked AC servo drives will become the preferred new method to replace traditional PLC control schemes.
case.
The network interface of AC servo drive is divided into high-end fast bus system and low-end general bus system. High-end total
Line systems, such as Beckhoff’s EtherCAT, can provide fast and synchronous information transmission, but the price is very high and the technology is complex.
Miscellaneous, not suitable for general ordinary applications. Low-end bus systems, such as RS485 systems, have poor real-time performance, and their networking capabilities are also
limited. The HS series of networked servo drives and Ethernet communication controllers launched by Hollysys Motor are aimed at servo networked applications
The low-cost and high-speed requirements of the company have proposed a complete set of application schemes, through the secondary network topology of Ethernet bus and CAN bus
The structure, to achieve high-speed, high-capacity and low-cost networking application solutions, has been applied and verified in many projects.
1.3.
HS series networked servo driver
HS series networked servo drives are a new generation of cost-effective, simple appearance launched by Beijing Hollysys Motor Technology Co., Ltd.
Simple, practical and reliable all-digital AC servo drive. The development of this drive continues and commercializes Beijing Hollysys Motor Technology
The technical research of AC servo spindle drive research and development conducted by the company during the period of undertaking the national science and technology major special project in 2009
As a result, 4 national patent technologies (3 inventions and 1 utility model) have been authorized.
Page 13
Product Overview
2
Figure 1-1 Appearance of Sentron HS series servo driver
This networked servo drive uses TI’s latest 32-bit dual-core digital signal processing chip with floating-point
The new motor control algorithm accurately controls the position, speed, acceleration and output torque of the permanent magnet synchronous servo motor. suitable
Used in industrial automation industries and fields such as machining centers, CNC servo control, textile machinery, etc.
HS series networked servo drives have the following characteristics:
1) General motion control function: position/speed/torque control, mode switching
2) Fast current loop floating-point CLA core processing, with good dynamic followability
3) Built-in grid voltage compensation control, automatically adapt to the fluctuation of grid voltage
4) Built-in 2-channel optional resonance low-pass filter and 2-stage resonance notch filter, effectively coping with mechanical resonance
5) Built-in proprietary intelligent regenerative braking control technology
6) Built-in torque observer technology, automatically adapt to load changes
7) The control gain can be switched or internal adaptive matching
8) Built-in dynamic brake control to provide additional safety protection for the drive
9) It has an automatic overload reduction algorithm, which can be parameterized to choose whether to overload protection, and parameterized settings to automatically smooth load reduction and recovery
Overload capacity
10) RS232 and RS485 communication interfaces that support MODBUS protocol, directly communicate with the host computer and touch screen, etc.
11) Support CAN bus interface, built-in proprietary communication protocol, convenient for customers to customize and use
12) The control port supports software distribution, logic settings, programmable filtering, flexible, convenient and reliable to use
13) Pulse analog interface, pulse input frequency up to 1MHZ
14) 2 channels of analog output can observe the internal state of the drive, which is convenient for on-site debugging
15) Built-in power device temperature monitoring and over-current, over-voltage and over-heat protection to ensure reliable drive
16) Reliability management functions such as historical fault records
Page 14
Product Overview
3
1.4.
Sentron MBOX communication controller
The second generation MBOX-V2 is a two-way Ethernet to CAN bus developed specifically for HS servo network control applications.
Data transfer includes 24 digital outputs, 2 analog outputs, 8 digital inputs, 6 analog inputs, and MODBUS
Multifunctional application boards such as RS232 interface for communication monitoring. Among them, the CAN bus adopts electrical isolation technology to ensure that the bus drive
Reliability and safety of movement.
Figure 1-2 MBOX-V2 communication controller
1.5.
Single-platform dynamic platform control system composed of HS servo driver and MBOX
HS series networked servo drives provide 3 kinds of bus interfaces, including RS232, RS485 and CAN bus.
The RS232 interface is a standard communication interface. RS485 and CAN bus are optional communication interfaces that use electrical isolation
Isolation and transient voltage suppression protection technology has good electromagnetic compatibility and reliability. Communication protocol of RS232 and RS485 interface
Protocol is the MODBUS RTU protocol commonly used in industry. The communication protocol of the CAN bus interface is the company’s independent intellectual property rights (already
Obtained invention patent) CAN bus communication method [2] .
HS series networked servo drives strengthen the control function in bus mode, supporting RS232, RS485 and CAN
Multiple bus mode control of the bus interface, including:
1) Torque mode control of bus interface
2) Speed ​​mode control of bus interface
3) Relative position mode control of the bus interface
4) Absolute position mode control of bus interface
The standard RS232 interface realizes the point-to-point communication between the HS servo drive and the host computer or touch screen, which can realize the
Servo drive status monitoring, parameter reading and writing, and bus mode control are often used for parameter configuration and operation monitoring of servo drives
control. When the user requires the network operation of HS networked servo drives, RS485 bus or CAN bus can be selected. Generally
In other words, the flexibility and reliability of the CAN bus is more suitable for networked real-time control, while MODBUS communication can be
Carrying large data packets is more suitable for large-capacity parameter transfer and data monitoring that does not require real-time performance.

Product Overview
4
The following figure shows the HS networked servo drive using CAN bus and MBOX communication controller to form analog or Ethernet control
The typical architecture of the system. The Ethernet communication between MBOX and the host computer is realized through the switch.
The CAN bus communication is realized between the MBOX. In addition, the MBOX can also be connected to the local computer or touch screen based on the RS232 interface.
The MODBUS communication of the port is convenient for monitoring and debugging. At the same time, MBOX can also provide 8 digital inputs and 24 digital inputs.
Out and 2 analog output interfaces, easy to realize low-cost digital and analog interface data acquisition and control through the Ethernet bus.
Figure 1-3 Single-platform dynamic platform control system composed of HS servo CAN bus network and MBOX control board

1.6.
Multi-platform control application scheme based on Ethernet for dynamic platform
The maximum number of nodes on the CAN bus of each MBOX is related to the transmission distance and baud rate. The number of common application nodes are: 3, 6,
9, 16, etc. The Ethernet interfaces of the MBOX are connected together through the switch. When the ports of a switch are not enough, you can use
Another switch expands. In the application, each MBOX is assigned an ID number, the ID number uses the Ethernet IP address to
Represents, for example: 192.168.1.100. The control node formed by each MBOX, as a whole, only needs to be connected to the outside
A 220V power cord and an Ethernet network cable are required, which greatly simplifies the realization of on-site wiring projects. In addition, the ether
Network communication is realized by 10M/100M adaptive mode, which has the characteristics of high-speed data transmission, reliability and large capacity.

1.7.
Multi-platform control application scheme based on analog quantity of dynamic platform
This scheme is mainly to facilitate the use of the upper computer control technology route of the DAC board control method.
The analog quantity interfaces of MBOX are connected together through the DAC output buffer circuit of the upper computer. The analog quantity interface is 0~10V, analog
The position of the electric cylinder corresponding to the quantity can be set by the parameters of MBOX. The following is an application scheme using analog control.

1.8.
Dynamic platform-based multi-platform control application scheme based on a hybrid of analog and Ethernet
The analog interface of the first MBOX is connected together through the DAC output buffer circuit of the upper computer, the analog interface is 0~10V,
The MBOX working in the analog interface mode will automatically output UDP data packets similar to the Ethernet of the host computer, which can be used for subsequent use.
Synchronous motion control of other MBOX cascaded by the router. The advantage of this method is that it simplifies the software development work of the host computer, but
At the same time, the advantages of the Ethernet solution are retained.

CAN communication and Ethernet technology of HS networked servo drive and MBOX communication control board is a general technology
The product is customized to develop and apply the program design. The advantages of the program include:
1) High-speed and large-capacity communication
2) Convenient and flexible networking, high reliability
3) Strong scalability and simple field wiring
4) Easy to monitor and diagnose
5) Cost-effectiveness is better than traditional PLC and control board solutions
This solution can be widely used in industrial automation network assembly line control, using the dynamic (4D/5D/7D) cinema and six electric cylinders
The degree of freedom platform, as well as the stage, fountain and other special effects control pan-industrial applications. Servo drive networking control customized solutions are in practice
While meeting the needs of users, it has also achieved the best engineering realization of technical solutions and target projects. Hollysys Motor strongly supports according to customers
Technical development and engineering realization of customized application schemes on demand.

Installation wiring

Chapter 2 Installation and Wiring of Dynamic Platform System
2.1.
HS servo directly connects with limit sensor
In the dynamic platform system, for safety protection, two limit sensors are generally installed at both ends of the electric cylinder. Limit
The sensor is generally connected to the overtravel input terminal of the servo drive, so as to realize the protection action of prohibition of forward rotation and prohibition of reverse rotation, and avoid
The electric cylinder is used for overtravel. Under normal circumstances, the upper limit sensor may not be connected in order to save costs. Users in this situation
In this case, the soft protection can also be achieved by setting the soft limit parameters of the electric cylinder of the MBOX.
In some application engineering practice, the dynamic platform hopes to realize the complete infinite sensor and electronic ruler feedback in order to simplify
System Implementation. The MBOX dynamic platform controller supports the initial positioning and normal operation of the dynamic platform with a complete infinite sensor, but it does not
Including the following combinations of applications:
1. The electric cylinder does not have the function of anti-rotation device
2. The connection between the electric cylinder and the moving part of the platform adopts a ball shaft connection method
When the electric cylinder and its installation are the above-mentioned combined applications, there is no difference between the linear movement of the electric cylinder and the rotational movement of the motor.
There is the ability to repeat positioning, the reciprocating rotation of the motor will cause the linear motion of the electric cylinder to continuously slip in one direction and accumulate
The top cylinder situation occurs. This situation is generally due to the fact that the electric cylinder manufacturer cancels the anti-rotation device due to cost considerations, and the electric cylinder
Occurs when the integrated application manufacturer adopts the ball-shaft connection structure. (If the connection part adopts fish-eye structure or universal joint structure,
It will also avoid the occurrence of electric cylinder slippage and accumulating to the top cylinder).
For additional safety operation protection, or to avoid the accumulation of electric cylinder slippage, which may cause the jacking cylinder and cause damage to the drive and motor,
Generally, two limit sensors are installed at both ends of the electric cylinder. The limit sensor is generally connected to the overtravel input terminal of the servo drive.
So as to realize the protection action of prohibition of forward rotation and prohibition of reverse rotation, and avoid overtravel use of electric cylinder.
When the user decides to install a limit sensor on the electric cylinder, there is no need to configure an external power supply. Due to the use of HS servo drive
Actuator, can provide 12V (within 100mA) power supply, so the external limit switch and HS servo drive can be directly connected
Connection, saving the cost and wiring of external power supply.

2.4.
HS servo external electromagnetic brake (brake) relay
In the case of medium and large dynamic platform applications, in order to prevent the servo motor from being energized, de-energized or malfunctioning,
If the platform falls due to gravity (or external force), it is necessary to use a servo motor with an electromagnetic brake (holding brake).
When using the HS series servo driver to control the electromagnetic brake, set any of SignalOut 1～4 of CN2 port of HS servo
The digital output signal port is equipped with an electromagnetic brake control (BRK-OFF) signal, and the motor is controlled through an external relay and power supply
The brake coil is switched on and off to achieve the purpose of controlling the electromagnetic brake, as shown in the figure below.

Chapter 4 Ethernet Bus Communication Protocol
4.1. Overview of MBOX Ethernet Communication
This system adopts the Ethernet LAN + CAN bus control scheme to realize the networked servo control of the dynamic platform. its
Among them, MBOX Ethernet data communication adopts UDP communication protocol.
4.2. MBOX Ethernet communication protocol
The following introduces the basic framework and specific communication protocol of MBOX's Ethernet communication.
4.2.1. The basic framework of MBOX Ethernet communication
Ethernet data communication adopts UDP communication protocol, and the basic format of UDP is as follows. By MAC address, IP
Address, and user-defined UDP source port number and destination port number to control the flow of Ethernet data. move
The control information interacted by the sensor platform is reflected in the UDP data part.

4.2.2. UDP data method of MBOX Ethernet information transmission
This communication method can realize point-to-point interaction and broadcast communication, as well as point-to-multipoint interaction and broadcast communication.
It can be addressed by MAC address, IP address, and port number. When the MAC address is all 6 FFs, it means that the physical address is wide
Broadcast; when the IP segment address is 4 FFs, it means logical address broadcast.
In this article, the UPD data part of the Ethernet is divided into 3 sub-domains, namely the application control domain
(AppControlField), application processor field (AppWhoFiled), and application data field (AppDataField).

AppWhoField
Who

Accept

$.$
$.$
The $. in the table is used to represent 1 byte of data. $.$ means 2 bytes of data, and the rest can be deduced by analogy.
Generally, the WhoAccept code of the application processor domain is used to confirm the recipient of the message, indicating the row and column
Location selection. When it is ff.ff, it means full reception; xx.ff: column reception; ff.xx: row reception; xx.yy: table
Show point to receive, 00.00 is indicated in the message sent by the master station of the broadcasting computer as no need to receive; sent from the MBOX slave station
The message indicates that it only needs to be received by the host computer of the broadcast.
Generally, the WhoReply code of the application processor field is used to confirm the responder of the message, indicating the row and column
Location selection. When it is ff.ff, it means full response; xx.ff: column response; ff.xx: row response; xx.yy: table
Show point to answer. 00.00 is expressed in the message sent by the master station of the broadcasting computer as no need to answer;
Through the row and column position information of different application processor domains, the broadcasting computer can construct multiple MBOXs.
Information exchange in a matrix combination in full mode, row mode, column mode, and dot mode Q&A mode or broadcast mode.
The application data field (AppDataField) represents the corresponding data information when different function codes are selected. MBOX branch
The basic operations of function codes and application data fields in supported UDP data communication are as follows:
1) MBOX takes the initiative to report the specified status information
2) The operation of reading the MBOX register by the master station of the broadcasting computer
3) Write MBOX register operation by the master station of the broadcasting computer
4) The master station of the broadcasting computer transmits the MBOX broadcasting data information
4.2.3. MBOX takes the initiative to report the specified status information
When the MBOX is running monitoring, timing or failures and other situations that require active alarms, it will report to the Ethernet master station
Report running status.
The report data is: DX start address + DX data length.
The start address and data length are set by MBOX's corresponding FX parameters, please refer to chapter 1.5.6.

4.3 MBOX and Ethernet connection establishment and monitoring
The PING command (Ethernet ICMP protocol) can be used to determine whether the MBOX has established an Ethernet connection with the computer.
The connection relationship of the net.
In addition, the Wireshark software can be used to realize the monitoring of the packet capture of the MBOX's Ethernet operating data.
4.3.1. The PING command realizes the Ethernet connection establishment test
When the MBOX is connected to the Ethernet, you can use the PING command to test whether the Ethernet is connected.
Generally, it is recommended to configure the host computer and MBOX to the same LAN segment first.
In the example below, the IP address of the MBOX is configured as: 192.168.15.201
Page 49
Ethernet bus communication protocol
38
Figure 4-1 PING command to query network connection status
The above PING command test results show that the connection between the host computer and the MBOX has been established well.
4.3.2. TCP debugging assistant realizes debugging of Ethernet communication protocol
Through a small software called "TCP Debugging Assistant", simple application testing and testing of Ethernet communication protocol can be realized.
Debugging provides convenience for subsequent programming.
4.3.3. WireShark realizes Ethernet communication monitoring
WireShark software is an open source, free and easy-to-use Ethernet protocol operation monitoring software. Use this software to
Conveniently understand the communication protocol of this system, and effectively help realize the programming and testing of the main control computer.

Chapter 5 Operation Setting of Dynamic Platform
5.1 How to stop when the dynamic platform fails
When the MBOX dynamic platform controller detects a fault, it can stop in two ways as follows.
Parameter number
Parameter Description
Predetermined area
Setting unit factory setting
Fn 00A
The method of stopping the MBOX after discovering a fault:
0: Servo enable, turn off and stop; 1: Servo keep
Location shutdown
0~1
-
1
The stop mode of mode 0 can completely shut down the servo drive. When the configured HS servo drive is configured with dynamic
When the brake is sensed and the relevant dynamic brake use parameters are set, the mechanical part of the platform can be dynamically braked, otherwise,
The mechanical part of the platform is in a state of complete mechanical freedom.
The stop mode of mode 1 can keep the mechanical part of the platform related to the servo drive shaft still running normally.
The state at the time of the failure.

5.3.3. Synchronous setting of MBOX 's position operation
There is a slight difference between the clock of the MBOX and the clock of the host computer. In order to ensure that the Ethernet playback data enters
It is executed in time after MBOX to ensure the synchronization of position control and playback. Fn 012 can be modified to speed up the movement.
The completion of the work avoids the accumulation of excessive data in the Ethernet data buffer, which causes the execution of the dynamic platform to lag.
Parameter number
Parameter Description
Predetermined area
Setting unit
Factory setting
Fn 012
MBOX playback action controls playback speed
(Achieve acceleration and deceleration) Less than 1000: Automatic
Automatically adjust the playback speed mode; greater than or equal to
1000: Use FX to set parameters.
-1~10000
-
1200
When the parameter is 1000, it means that it is carried out at the rated speed. The larger the value, the faster the execution speed of playback.
It can lead to a sense of stepping of the dynamic platform. The smaller the value, the slower the playback speed, which may cause the execution of the dynamic platform.
Line lags. The default value of 1200 can generally meet the synchronization and fluency of platform playback actions at the same time.
When Fn 012 is less than 1000, it means that the playback speed mode is automatically adjusted according to the desired lag time. MBOX
Automatic processing. The relevant parameters are as follows:
Parameter number
Parameter Description
Predetermined area
Setting unit
Factory setting
Fn 01D
MBOX playback action controls playback speed
Automatically adjust the delay tolerance time (unit:
ms)
1~30000
ms
100
Fn 01E MBOX playback speed control K parameter
1~1000
0.01
50
Fn 01F MBOX playback speed control T parameter
0~10000
ms
50
5.3.4. MBOX 's Jog Mode Execution Time Setting
The time point of PlayTime when MBOX receives zero relative movement time; or new absolute time play data
If there is no change, it is regarded as the point-to-point mode, which means to directly change the position with the time specified by the internal parameter Fn 013.

5.3.5. MBOX 's back mode execution time setting
When MBOX receives negative relative movement time; or new absolute time to play data, if PlayTime
If the time point is smaller than the previous time point, it is considered to be the backward mode, which means that the time specified by the internal parameter Fn 014 is directly used.
Change the position in time.

5.3.6. Fast forward mode judgment and execution time setting of MBOX
When the MBOX receives new play data, if the time value of PlayDeltaTime is greater than the set parameter value
Fn 015, it is judged to be the fast forward mode.
When the value of Fn 015 is 0, the judgment of fast forward mode is cancelled.

5.3.8. The processing method of Ethernet playback position data
MBOX internally puts the play position command of the Ethernet in the FIFO buffer first. When hope MBOX
When always executing the latest playback position command, set Fn 01C to 0. When wishing to enter all via Ethernet
When all MBOX play position commands are executed, set Fn 01C to 1.
Parameter number
Parameter Description
Predetermined area
Setting unit
Factory setting
Fn 01C
UDP FIFO position command data FIFO enable
Use permission signs. 0: Do not use FIFO, use
The latest location data to ensure the latest instructions
Execution 1: Execute position index in FIFO order
Order to ensure the execution of all instructions;
0~1
-
1

5.7 MBOX's Ethernet port indicator setting
MBOX supports standard 10/100M Ethernet. The Ethernet port has 2 indicator lights, which can be used for monitoring
The operating status of the Ethernet. Generally use the default default value.
Page 62
Dynamic platform operation settings
51
Parameter number
Parameter Description
Predetermined area
Setting unit
Factory setting
Fn 051
Ethernet indicator A working mode configuration
0~15
-
2
Fn 052
Ethernet indicator B working mode configuration
0~15
-
6
When used in a special test, the specific setting instructions are as follows: The status of the indicator light can be set as required. Assume
The meaning of the set value is as follows:
0
0000 = Off (pin is driven low)
1
0001 = On (pin is driven high)
2
0010 = Display link state; pin is driven high when linked
3
0011 = Display collision events; pin is temporarily driven high when a collision occurs
4
0100 = Display transmit events; pin is driven high while a packet is being transmitted
5
0101 = Display receive events; pin is driven high while a packet is being received
6
0110 = Display transmit and receive events; pin is driven high while a packet is either
being received or transmitted
7
0111 = Display duplex state; pin is driven high when the PHY is in full duplex
(PHYDPX (ESTAT<10>) is „1‟) and a link is present
8
1000 = Display speed state; pin is driven high when in 100 Mbps mode and a link is
present
9
1001 = Display link state, transmit events; pin is driven high when a link is present and
driven low while a packet is being transmitted
10
1010 = Display link state, receive events; pin is driven high when a link is present and
driven low while a packet is being received
11
1011 = Display link state, transmit and receive events; pin is driven high when a link is
present and driven low while a packet is being received or transmitted
12
1100 = Display link state, collision events; pin is driven high when a link is present and
driven low temporarily when a collision occurs
13
1101 = Reserved
14
1110 = Display link and duplex state, transmit and receive events(1)
15
1111 = Display link and speed state, transmit and receive events(1)
5.8 MBOX Ethernet no playback data timeout detection
When MBOX is running, when new UDP play command data is detected, the keyboard display part will display UDP play
The absolute time value of the command or the running frame value. When there is no new UDP playback data, the keyboard display part will display
READY means waiting for a new UDP play data command.
Parameter Fn053 can set the size of the time window for detecting the appearance of a new play command.
Parameter number
Parameter Description
Predetermined area
Setting unit
Factory setting
Fn 053
Ethernet no new playback data timeout detection parameter 50~10000
4ms
100

6.1.13 Cumulative load rate weighted effective running time of dynamic platform
For each servo drive of the dynamic platform, MBOX can accumulate the effective running time weighted according to the load rate.
Effective running time can be used for reliability management such as service life evaluation of servo motors or electric cylinders.

6.2 Local operation monitoring based on keyboard display
Through the keyboard Fn xxx, Dn xxx and En xxx, the operating status of the MBOX can be set to a set of parameters
Status and fault monitoring.
6.3 Local operation monitoring based on MODBUS
The RS232 port of MBOX supports MODBUS communication, which can facilitate the localization of the dynamic platform
Operational monitoring. Users can write the host computer or touch screen monitoring program by themselves.
Beijing Hollysys Electric Technology Co., Ltd. provides local monitoring solutions based on touch screens. Please contact us if you need them.
6.4 Remote operation monitoring based on Ethernet
The MBOX's Ethernet communication protocol supports all parameters and status access, and users can write the host computer remotely
Monitoring program.
In order to facilitate users to familiarize themselves with the system, our company provides a free debugging and testing interface software for the dynamic platform
For MBOXPlay, please contact Beijing Hollysys Electric Company.

Customized matching of HS servo parameters

Appendix: Customized matching of HS servo parameters
A.1. Overview of parameter adjustment of HS servo drive
The standard factory default parameters of the HS servo drive are suitable for most cases, using the traditional pulse plus direction method to advance.
Drive system parameters under line control. The default parameters of the HS servo drive can be re-powered by setting Fn_007 to 1.
You can restore the default parameters.
When the HS servo drive is used with MBOX for dynamic platform networked servo control applications, the HS servo drive needs
To be adjusted from standard parameters to customized control parameters. For the parameter adjustment method, please refer to "HS Series All Digital AC Servo Drive
Instruction Manual of the Device.
To adjust the kernel parameters of the HS servo drive, you first need to set the system password of Fn_008 to the technical support password or enable
Send support password.
A.2. Parameter adjustment of HS servo drive (required option)
When the HS servo standard driver is used in a dynamic platform system, the parameters that must be adjusted include:
A.2.1. Control mode parameters
Need to set Fn_000 to 3, use CAN bus communication mode to realize the communication control between HS servo and MBOX.

A.2.2. Overtravel parameters
After the MBOX version 31012, the dynamic platform supports the initial positioning and operation of a completely infinite position sensor, generally overtravel
The detection function can be set to 0, which means no overtravel (forward rotation prohibition/reverse rotation prohibition).
However, when the user selects the external limit sensor of the electric cylinder of the dynamic platform, the overtravel parameter needs to be turned on.
First, you need to ensure that the overtravel detection function is in the detection state, and confirm that the configuration Fn_02F is 1. as follows:

When the overtravel detection function is enabled, the input signal of forward rotation prohibition and reverse rotation prohibition enters the servo drive from the digital input port
In order to ensure the safety protection even when the forward rotation is prohibited or the reverse rotation is prohibited, the overtravel detection sensor is disconnected.
Generally, the positive rotation prohibition and reverse rotation prohibition signals adopt the negative logic effective method (that is, the effective method and the enable method and other digital port input method logic
in contrast). Generally, the output form of the active limit switch is normally closed in the normal state, and disconnected in the limit state (Break-Contact).
The use of combined negative logic.
In addition, in some cases, passive limit switches are used, which are normally open under normal conditions and normally closed under limit conditions. You need to fix
To correct the input signal logic of forward rotation prohibition and reverse rotation prohibition, you can reverse the setting through the digital input channel of the overtravel limit signal.
can. That is: the logic of the input signal can be changed by modifying the values ​​of the configuration parameters "Fn 00E" and "Fn 00F", as shown in the following table:

Generally suitable for applications where passive limit switches are used for over-travel protection.
A.2.3. Motor overload and automatic derating parameters
Through the parameter Fn_0E2, you can select the handling method when the drive is overloaded. If Fn_0E2=1, the overload occurs.
When Fn_0E2=0, the drive will stop with an alarm and display E_oLod, which is consistent with the general servo overload processing; when Fn_0E2=0, then
When overload occurs, the drive will not stop, and the maximum torque of the motor will be automatically reduced and restored to ensure the safety of the motor and the drive.
The price only slightly affects the speed of motor motion control.
Parameter number
Parameter Description
Predetermined area
Setting unit
Custom matching

Overload alarm enable: 0: Overload protection (limited to rated rotation
Torque output) but no alarm; 1: Overload, alarm and shutdown
0~1
1
0

In addition, the switching process of overload and automatic load reduction can also be smoothly adjusted.

A.2.4. Motor stall detection parameters
The motor stall detection time parameter Fn 0D4 is used for the judgment in the case of a stall fault with locked rotor and equal loss.
When the automatic overload reduction function is activated, it is generally necessary to adjust the motor stall detection time Fn 0D4 to be greater than
10000 (unit ms), to avoid that the motor has not entered the automatic load reduction stage, the drive will show En_SPEE locked-rotor stall report first
police. Under normal circumstances, the overload is set to 2 times the overload capacity of 10S. According to the practical test, the motor stall detection time can be set to Fn 0D4
Set to a value of 15000. (Indicating that the maximum allowable 15S full locked rotor)

A.2.5. CAN bus settings
The CAN bus baud rate HS_Fn_0F3 of HS servo needs to be set to be consistent with MBOX. CAN bus of MBOX
The baud rate parameter is MBOX_Fn_061, and the default value is 500KHZ.
The CAN bus node number of HS servo is in the range of 0~255, which is set by the configuration parameter “Fn 0F4”, and is set by the network of the servo drive.
It is determined by the network position number.
The CAN bus of HS series servo drives is equipped with a bus protocol that supports independent intellectual property rights (invention patents), and supports grouped operations.
The number of group numbers allocated is set by the configuration parameter "Fn 0F5". When this parameter is matched with MBOX, just keep the original default value.

A.2.6. CAN bus report mode configuration of HS servo
It is necessary to set Fn_0F6 of HS servo to -1 in order to obtain the servo operation information of the MBOX control servo drive.
In addition, set Fn_0F7 to 1250, basically every 1250*0.4ms=500ms, the servo drive automatically sends out CAN
A customized running status information on the bus, including the position, speed, load rate and running status word information of the motor.

A.3.2. Motor control speed loop parameters
Generally, the first gain is sufficient, and you can set a relatively mild speed loop adjustment parameter first. Such as:
Speed ​​loop proportional gain: Fn_087=5.00;
Speed ​​loop integral time constant: Fn_088=10.00
When stronger rigidity is required, the proportional gain can be increased and the integral time constant can be reduced.
A.3.3. Motor control position loop parameters
Generally, the first gain is sufficient, and you can first set a relatively mild position loop adjustment parameter. Such as:
Position loop proportional gain: Fn_05C=0.4
When stronger rigidity is required, the proportional gain can be increased.
A.3.4. Motor control current loop parameters
Under normal circumstances, you can first set a relatively mild current loop adjustment parameter. Such as:
Current loop proportional gain: Fn_151=0.400
Current loop integral time constant: Fn_152=5.00ms
When stronger rigidity is needed, the proportional gain can be increased and the integral time constant can be reduced, but it may cause the running noise of the motor.
The tone increases.
A.3.5. Position out-of-tolerance protection parameters
In order to ensure that even if the temporary position is out of tolerance, it will not cause the driver to alarm, so that the dynamic action can run continuously without stopping, you can change
Fn_0DA is set to 0 to cancel the alarm function of position out of tolerance.

A.4. HS servo drive custom matching parameter retention and recovery
The parameters of the HS servo drive, when used as customized matching for a specific application, can retain the current parameter value to the servo
User data storage area. By setting Fn_007 to -1, and power on again, the current FX operating parameters can be retained as a whole.
User data storage area. It is recommended that users use this function to retain the parameters when they are satisfied with the current HS servo parameters during the debugging process.
Count for later use.
The standard factory default parameters of the HS servo drive can be restored to the default by setting Fn_007 to 1, and powering on again
parameter. When the user wants to restore the self-retained parameters, he can set Fn_007 to 2, and then power on again to restore the backup protection.
Leave the parameters.
A.5. Quickly adjust the parameters of HS servo drive in batches
The parameters of the HS servo drive support RS232 or RS485 mode, and use MODBUS communication protocol to realize data
Exchange function. When a new set of parameters is configured, the subsequent drives do not need to be set manually through the keyboard display.
After reading and storing the first set of parameters, use the communication interface to perform batch copy and write processing.
When multiple drives are networked, the difference between the network ID numbers of different drives must be paid attention to. HS matched to MBOX
Servo is to set the CAN bus node number parameter Fn_0F4 of each axis servo. You can use the keyboard to display the interface, or
Update in the communication download data.
For HS servo drives after version 30916, it has begun to support the MBOX dynamic platform to apply a customized version of the motor
The parameter number, except for the CAN bus node number parameter Fn_0F4, the parameter defaults to 1, and needs to be configured on site according to the actual situation.
The currently supported custom parameter numbers include:
